member.name: T:PdfViewer4WinNet.ViewerTextOrder
member.summary: Used in PdfViewerPreferences to specify the predominant reading order for text.

member.name: F:PdfViewer4WinNet.ViewerTextOrder.L2R
member.summary: Left to right.

member.name: F:PdfViewer4WinNet.ViewerTextOrder.R2L
member.summary: Right to left ( including vertical writing systems such as Chinese, Japanese, and Korean ).

member.name: T:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer
member.summary: The PDF Viewer control

member.summary: Required designer variable.

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Clean up any resources being used.
member.param: true if managed resources should be disposed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.InitializeComponent
member.summary: Required method for Designer support - do not modify the contents of this method with the code editor.

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a PdfViewer object

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.GetPageCount(System.String)
member.summary: A fast method to obtain the page count of a specified PDF document.
member.param: The path of the PDF file for which to get the page count.
member.returns: The number of pages in the specified PDF document.

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.GetPageCount(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: A fast method to obtain the page count of a specified PDF document.
member.param: The stream containing the PDF document for which to get the page count.
member.returns: The number of pages in the specified PDF document.

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.RemoveProductLogo
member.summary: Call this method to remove the product logo image when no PDF document is loaded in the viewer.

members.member:
Opens and displays the specified document within the browser.
The pathname of the file to be opened. false if the file could not be opened, true otherwise.cfr1_Razvan

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.LoadStream(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Opens and displays the specified stream within the browser.
member.param: The stream to be opened.
member.returns: false if the file could not be opened, true otherwise.

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.ReloadPdfDocument
member.summary: Call this method to reload the currently loaded PDF document after changing the PdfViewerPreferences or the PdfSecurityOptions.
member.returns: Return true if the document was reloaded or false if the document was not reloaded

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.GoToFirstPage
member.summary: Goes to the first page in the document, maintaining the current location within the page and zoom level.

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.GoToLastPage
member.summary: Goes to the last page in the document, maintaining the current location within the page and zoom level.

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.GoToNextPage
member.summary: Goes to the next page in the document, if it exists. Maintains the current location within the page and zoom level.

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.GoToPreviousPage
member.summary: Goes to the previous page in the document, if it exists. Maintains the current location within the page and zoom level.

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.Print
member.summary: Prints the document according to the options selected in a user dialog box. The options include embedded printing (printing within a bounding rectangle on a given page), as well as interactive printing to a specified printer. This method returns immediately, even if the printing has not completed. NOTE:If security settings do not allow printing, this method will be ignored.

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.PrintAll
member.summary: Prints the entire document without displaying a user dialog box. The current printer, page settings, and job settings are used. This method returns immediately, even if the printing has not completed. NOTE:If security settings do not allow printing, this method will be ignored.

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.PrintAllFit(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Prints the entire document without displaying a user dialog box, and the pages are shrunk, if necessary, to fit into the imageable area of a page in the printer. The current printer, page settings, and job settings are used. This method returns immediately, even if the printing has not completed. NOTE:If security settings do not allow printing, this method will be ignored.
member.param: Specifies whether the pages will be shrunk, if necessary, to fit into the imageable area of a page in the printer.

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.PrintPages(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Prints the specified pages without displaying a user dialog box. The current printer, page settings, and job settings are used.This method returns immediately, even if the printing has not completed. NOTE:If security settings do not allow printing, this method will be ignored.
member.param: The page number of the first page to be printed. The first page in a document is page 0.
The page number of the last page to be printed.

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.PrintPagesFit(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Prints the specified pages without displaying a user dialog box. The current printer, page settings, and job settings are used. This method returns immediately, even if the printing has not completed. NOTE:If security settings do not allow printing, this method will be ignored.
member.param: The page number of the first page to be printed. The first page in a document is page 0.
The page number of the last page to be printed.
Specifies whether the pages will be shrunk, if necessary, to fit into the imageable area of a page in the printer.

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.PrintWithDialog
member.summary: Prints the document according to the options selected in a user dialog box. The options include embedded printing (printing within a bounding rectangle on a given page), as well as interactive printing to a specified printer. This method returns immediately, even if the printing has not completed. NOTE:If security settings do not allow printing, this method will be ignored.

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.GoBackwardStack
member.summary: Goes to the previous view on the view stack, if the previous view exists. The previous view may be in a different document.

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.GoForwardStack
member.summary: Goes to the next view on the view stack, if the next view exists. The next view may be in a different document.

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.SetCurrentHighlight(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Highlights the text selection within the specified bounding rectangle on the current page.
member.param: The distance in points from the left side of the page.
The distance in points from the top of the page.
The width of the bounding rectangle.
The height of the bounding rectangle.

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.SetCurrentPage(System.Int32)
member.summary: Goes to the specified page in the document. Maintains the current location within the page and zoom level.
member.param: The page number of the destination page. The first page in a document is page 1.

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.SetLayoutMode(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the layout mode for a page view according to the specified string.
member.param: Possible values: "DontCare": use the current user preference "SinglePage": use single page mode (as it would have appeared in pre-Acrobat 3.0 viewers) "OneColumn": use one-column continuous mode "TwoColumnLeft": use two-column continuous mode with the first page on the left "TwoColumnRight": use two-column continuous mode with the first page on the right

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.SetNamedDest(System.String)
member.summary: Changes the page view to the named destination in the specified string.
member.param: The named destination to which the viewer will go.

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.SetPageMode(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the page mode according to the specified string.
member.param: Possible values: "none": displays the document, but does not display bookmarks or thumbnails (default) "bookmarks": displays the document and bookmarks "thumbs": displays the document and thumbnails

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.SetShowScrollbars(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines whether scrollbars will appear in the document view.
member.param: A true value indicates that scrollbars will appear, false indicates that they will not.

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.SetShowToolbar(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Determines whether a toolbar will appear in the viewer.
member.param: A positive value indicates that the toolbar will appear, 0 indicates that it will not.

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.SetView(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the view of a page according to the specified string.
member.param: Possible values: "Fit": fits the entire page within the window both vertically and horizontally. "FitH": fits the entire width of the page within the window. "FitV": fits the entire height of the page within the window. "FitB": fits the bounding box within the window both vertically and horizontally. "FitBH": fits the entire width of the bounding box within the window. "FitBV": fits the entire height of the bounding box within the window.

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.SetViewRect(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the view rectangle according to the specified coordinates.
member.param: The upper left horizontal coordinate.
The vertical coordinate in the upper left corner.
The horizontal width of the rectangle.
The vertical height of the rectangle.

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.SetViewScroll(System.String,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the view of a page according to the specified string. Depending on the view mode, the page is either scrolled to the right or scrolled down by the amount specified in offset.
member.param: Possible values: "Fit": fits the entire page within the window both vertically and horizontally. "FitH": fits the entire width of the page within the window. "FitV": fits the entire height of the page within the window. "FitB": fits the bounding box within the window both vertically and horizontally. "FitBH": fits the entire width of the bounding box within the window. "FitBV": fits the entire height of the bounding box within the window.
The horizontal or vertical coordinate positioned either at the left or top edge.

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.SetZoom(System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the magnification according to the specified value.
member.param: The desired zoom factor, expressed as a percentage (for example, 100 represents a magnification of 100%).

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.SetZoomScroll(System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the magnification according to the specified value, and scrolls the page view both horizontally and vertically according to the specified amounts.
member.param: The desired zoom factor, expressed as a percentage (for example, 1.0 represents a magnification of 100%).
The horizontal coordinate positioned at the left edge.
The vertical coordinate positioned at the top edge.

member.name: M:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.Close
member.summary: Releases the resources used by this control

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.LicenseKey
member.summary: Gets or sets the license key

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.PdfViewerPreferences
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object controlling the PDF document viewer preferences. The properties of this object allows you hide toolbars and menus, hide all navigation panels, change the page mode and the page layout. The PDF document viewer preferences are modified before the document is displayed by the viewer. The modified viewer preferences are taking effect after the document is reloaded in the viewer control.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.PdfSecurityOptions
member.summary: Gets a reference to the object to controlling the PDF document security settings like user and owner password, restrict printing or editing of the generated PDF document. The PDF document security settings are modified before the document is displayed by the viewer. The modified security settings are taking effect after the document is reloaded in the viewer control.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.OpenPassword
member.summary: A password used to open a password protected PDF document in order to change its viewer preferences and security options.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.PageCount
member.summary: Gets the page count of the currently loaded PDF document.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.CurrentPage
member.summary: Goes to the specified page in the document. Maintains the current location within the page and zoom level. The first page in a document is page 1. A negative value means that the viewer will go to a default page. The default value is -1.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.PageLayoutMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the layout mode for a page view. The default value is NotSet.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.ShowNavigationPanel
member.summary: Set this property to false before loading the first document in the viewer to hide the navigation panel from the left side of the viewer containing buttons to view the bookmarks, thumbnails, file attachments and comments of the document. The default value of this property is true. This property is a shortcut for the PdfViewerPreferences.HideWindowUI.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.DocumentDisplayMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the display mode of the document to show thumbnails or bookmarks. The default value is NotSet.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.ShowScrollbars
member.summary: Show or hide the viewer scrollbars. The default value is true.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.ShowToolbarMode
member.summary: Show or hide the viewer toolbar. The default value is NotSet.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.PageFitMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the fit mode of the PDF page in the viewer. The default value is NotSet.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.ZoomPercentage
member.summary: Gets or sets the zoom percentage of the viewer as a float number. For example, 100 represents a magnification of 100%. A negative value means the default zoom percentage is used. The default value is -1.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.CanAssembleDocument
member.summary: Can assemble the document (create bookmarks, thumbnail images or insert, rotate, delete pages). This property has effect when a 128 bit key is used. The default value is true.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.CanCopyContent
member.summary: Can copy the document content. The default value is true.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.CanEditAnnotations
member.summary: Can edit PDF document annotations. The default value is true.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.CanEditContent
member.summary: Can edit PDF document content. The default value is true.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.CanFillFormFields
member.summary: Can fill the form fields. This property has effect when a 128 bit key is used. The default value is true.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.CanPrint
member.summary: Can print the document. The default value is true.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.KeySize
member.summary: The dimension of the encryption key. By default a 128 bit key is used.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.OwnerPassword
member.summary: The password required to change permissions of the PDF document like printing or editing. The default value is an empty string. If the OwnerPassword property is an empty string and the UserPassword is not empty, the OwnerPassword will be automatically assigned with the value from UserPassword and when the PDF document is opened in the viewer using the user password (which is also the owner password) all the operations like printing, copying, etc will be allowed.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewer.UserPassword
member.summary: The password required to open the PDF document. The default value is an empty string. If the OwnerPassword property is an empty string and the UserPassword is not empty, the OwnerPassword will be automatically assigned with the value from UserPassword and when the PDF document is opened in the viewer using the user password (which is also the owner password) all the operations like printing, copying, etc will be allowed.

member.name: T:PdfViewer4WinNet.ShowToolbarMode
member.summary: The viewer toolbar display mode.

member.name: F:PdfViewer4WinNet.ShowToolbarMode.NotSet
member.summary: The default display mode.

member.name: F:PdfViewer4WinNet.ShowToolbarMode.Show
member.summary: Show the toolbar.

member.name: F:PdfViewer4WinNet.ShowToolbarMode.Hide
member.summary: Hide the toolbar.

member.summary: Options in PdfViewerPreferences for how the document should be displayed when opened.

member.name: F:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewerPageMode.UseNone
member.summary: Neither document outline nor thumbnail images visible.

member.name: F:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewerPageMode.UseOutlines
member.summary: Document outline (bookmarks) visible.

member.name: F:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewerPageMode.UseThumbs
member.summary: Thumbnail images visible.

member.name: F:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewerPageMode.FullScreen
member.summary: Full-screen mode, with no menu bar, window controls, or any other window visible.

member.name: F:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewerPageMode.UseOC
member.summary: Optional content group panel visible.

member.name: F:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewerPageMode.UseAttachments
member.summary: Document attachments visible.

member.summary: Returns the cached ResourceManager instance used by this class.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.Properties.Resources.Culture
member.summary: Overrides the current thread's CurrentUICulture property for all resource lookups using this strongly typed resource class.

member.name: T:PdfViewer4WinNet.PageLayoutMode
member.summary: The layout mode of the PDF page in the viewer.

member.summary: Use the default layout mode.

member.summary: Use the current user preference.

member.summary: Use single page mode (as it would have appeared in pre-Acrobat 3.0 viewers).

member.summary: Use one-column continuous mode.

member.summary: The page layout in PdfViewerPreferences to be used when the document is opened.

member.name: F:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewerPageLayout.SinglePage
member.summary: Display one page at a time.

member.name: F:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewerPageLayout.OneColumn
member.summary: Display the pages in one column.

member.name: F:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewerPageLayout.TwoColumnLeft
member.summary: Display the pages in two columns, with odd numbered pages on the left.

member.name: F:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewerPageLayout.TwoColumnRight

member.summary: Displays the document, but does not display bookmarks or thumbnails (default)

member.name: T:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfSecurityOptions
member.summary: This class encapsulates the options to control the PDF document security options. The PDF document is modified to apply the properties from the PdfSecurityOptions before being displayed in the viewer control and this might introduce an additional delay before the document is displayed.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfSecurityOptions.CanAssembleDocument
member.summary: Can assemble the document (create bookmarks, thumbnail images or insert, rotate, delete pages). This property has effect when a 128 bit key is used.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfSecurityOptions.CanCopyContent
member.summary: Can copy the document content.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfSecurityOptions.CanEditAnnotations
member.summary: Can edit PDF document annotations.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfSecurityOptions.CanEditContent
member.summary: Can edit PDF document content.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfSecurityOptions.CanFillFormFields
member.summary: Can fill the form fields. This property has effect when a 128 bit key is used. To disable form filling the CanEditContent and CanEditAnnotations must be set on false.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfSecurityOptions.CanPrint
member.summary: Can print the document.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfSecurityOptions.KeySize
member.summary: The dimension of the encryption key. By default a 128 bit key is used.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfSecurityOptions.OwnerPassword
member.summary: The password required to change permissions of the PDF document like printing or editing. If the OwnerPassword property is an empty string and the UserPassword is not empty, the OwnerPassword will be automatically assigned with the value from UserPassword and when the PDF document is opened in the viewer using the user password (which is also the owner password) all the operations like printing, copying, etc will be allowed.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfSecurityOptions.UserPassword
member.summary: The password required to open the PDF document.

member.name: T:PdfViewer4WinNet.EncryptionKeySize
member.summary: The length of the encryption key

member.name: F:PdfViewer4WinNet.EncryptionKeySize.EncryptKey128Bit
member.summary: A 128 bit length.

member.name: F:PdfViewer4WinNet.EncryptionKeySize.EncryptKey40Bit
member.summary: A 40 bit length.

member.name: T:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewerPreferences
member.summary: Represents the viewer preferences of the PDF document. The PDF document is modified to apply the properties from the PdfViewerPreferences before being displayed in the viewer control and this might introduce an additional delay before the document is displayed.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewerPreferences.HideMainToolbar
member.summary: A flag specifying whether to hide the viewer application’s tool bars when the document is active. Default value: False.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewerPreferences.HideMenuBar
member.summary: A flag specifying whether to hide the viewer application’s menu bar when the document is active. Default value: False.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewerPreferences.HideWindowUI
member.summary: A flag specifying whether to hide user interface elements in the document’s window (such as scroll bars and navigation controls), leaving only the document’s contents displayed. Default value: False.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewerPreferences.FitWindow
member.summary: A flag specifying whether to resize the document’s window to fit the size of the first displayed page. Default value: False.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewerPreferences.DisplayDocTitle
member.summary: A flag specifying whether the window’s title bar should display the document title taken from the title entry of the document information dictionary. Default value: False.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewerPreferences.NonFullScreenPageMode
member.summary: The document’s page mode, specifying how to display the document on exiting full-screen mode. This entry is meaningful only if the value of the PageMode entry in the catalog dictionary is FullScreen; it is ignored otherwise. Default value: UseNone.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewerPreferences.Direction
member.summary: The predominant reading order for text. Default value: L2R.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewerPreferences.PageMode
member.summary: Specifies how the document should be displayed when opened. Default value: UseNone.

member.name: P:PdfViewer4WinNet.PdfViewerPreferences.PageLayout
member.summary: The page layout to be used when the document is opened. Default value: OneColumn.
